snippet: Mr. Cruz became known among his fellow clerks for his death penalty advocacy and for dwelling on the lurid details of murders in his case summaries.
abstract: Ted Cruz is remembered for his passionate interest in death penalty cases while working as Supreme Court clerk during Chief Justice Rehnquist's 1996 term; Cruz, who tended to dwell on lurid details of cases rather than offering dispassionate review, provoked irritation from some colleagues who bristled at his writing style; cause came to define Cruz's legal career and help him break into politics.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Cruz became known among his fellow clerks for his death penalty advocacy and for dwelling on the lurid details of murders in his case summaries.

headline.main: As Supreme Court Clerk, Ted Cruz Made Death Penalty His Cause
headline.print_headline: Cruz at Supreme Court: On Murders, He Wrote
